Posts.Content: On 7/18/2008 Carolina wrote: Hi everyone - it's been a while since I've posted a message BUT I have a real problem.  I have been on Arimidex for 3 years now.  I didn't do well on Arimidex for the 1st 6 months but then everything got better - no pain anywhere!  The only thing I suffer from occassionally is joint stiffness - but that's not really an issue.  THEN in March of this year, my left rib cage began to hurt.  It has persisted until now (July).  I had breast cancer surgery (right side) in 2004.  But it is my left rib cage that is hurting.  I have had x-rays and a bone scan done and nothing is showing up.  So, now I wonder if it could be a side effect from the Arimidex?  Have any of you who are or have taken Arimidex experienced this problem?  The rib cage itself is tender to touch but mostly it just feels like a HUGE catch in my rib cage area - like something is in there.  This is worrisome to say the least.  Please write me back if any of you have experienced this kind of pain.  I can't imagine what it is as many of our vital organs are on our right side.  I look forward to hearing from any of you when you have a mintue to write.  Thanks!!  Carolyn in Washingto state I am a 52 yo right breast mastectomy patient as of 5/1/08. For a number of reasons; mainly diagnostics, I did not start Arimidex until 7/17/08. I tripped and fell on my right side 2 weeks ago. No pain or stiffness in the first 2 days and felt just fine. Now, almost 3 weeks out, I have terrible pain underneath my whole right breast, underarm and chest wall. At first I wanted to blame it on the fall. I called oncologist who referred me back to oncology surgeon (appt on 10/27).  You know how your mind starts to wonder.. I then start to think it is bone mets. (I was dcis with no lymph involvement; but you still get worried they missed something). After reading these posts, I am beginning to think it IS the drug, not my imagination, not my trip/fall. It hurts on inhalation (although not like pneumonia pain which I have had). It hurts to touch breast or rib cage.  I have my left breast adjustment surgery and nipple reconstruction Nov.6th and just want to put this stuff behind me, but now with the pain, I will always be thinking mets.
Posts.Title: Rib pain
